data.title: Cervest
data.description: Cervest offers cloud-based Climate Intelligence (CI) to empower enterprises, governments and financial services companies to manage and adapt to climate risk at an asset-level. Received 24M in funding in May 2021, [in the news](https://www.eu-startups.com/2021/05/cervest-secures-e24-6-million-to-launch-new-ai-powered-climate-intelligence-platform/)

data.title: Diode
data.description: Diode specialises in building electric vehicle implementation plans, matching them to the right infrastructure and securing the best deal.

data.title: Sunlight Financial
data.description: Sunlight Financial partners with Solar companies and Home Improvement contractors to secure financing for solar systems and home improvement projects. Raised $1.3bn via SPAC + PIPE deal in Feb 21, via [Techcrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2021/01/25/chamath-palihapitiyas-spac-for-sunlight-financial-is-another-sign-of-a-renewables-boom/)

data.title: Loanpal
data.description: partnership with sustainable home improvement professionals across the country to make sustainable home upgrades simple. Raised $800M in cash in Feb 21 to fund projects, from [Techcrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2021/01/27/renewable-investment-wave-continues-as-solar-lending-company-loanpal-raises-800-million/)

data.title: Virmati Energy
data.description: Virmati Energy was founded by Amit Gudka, one of the co-founder of Bulb. Virmati Energy whants to show that batteries are a totally viable part of our energy infrastructure with a portfolio of batteries in the UK. In the news Feb 21 from [BusinessGreen](https://www.businessgreen.com/news/4027455/bulb-founder-steps-focus-battery-storage-venture)

data.title: Pearl Street Technologies
data.description: Suite of Unified Grid Analyses with Renewables (SUGAR) is a simulation, optimization, and design platform for power grid planning, with applications for grid operators, utilities, project developers, and consultants. Backed by Powerhouse Ventures

data.title: Fluence
data.description: Fluence is the result of two industry powerhouses and pioneers in energy storage joining together to form a new company dedicated to innovating modern electric infrastructure. In January 2018, [Siemens](https://www.siemens.com/global/en/home/products/energy.html) and [AES](http://www.aes.com/home/default.aspx) launched Fluence. In Jan 2021 the Qatar Investment Authority is investing $125 million into them, [from TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/30/fluence-the-energy-storage-systems-developer-is-now-worth-over-1-billion-after-qia-investment/)

data.title: RES group
data.description: The world’s largest independent renewable energy company, 18GW Global Portfolio, Power Purchase Agreements, Asset Management

data.title: REA
data.description: The REA - association for renewable energy and clean technology - is a not-for-profit trade association, established in 2001.

data.title: Solar Trade Association
data.description: Our mission is to empower the UK solar transformation. We are paving the way for solar to deliver the maximum possible share of UK energy by 2030 by enabling a bigger and better solar industry.

data.title: Energy Institute
data.description: The Energy Institute is the not-for-profit chartered professional membership body bringing together expertise to tackle urgent global challenges. Responding to the climate emergency while meeting the energy needs of the world’s growing population calls for energy to be better understood, managed and valued. check their [barometer](https://www.energyinst.org/exploring-energy/resources/barometer)

data.title: DNV
data.description: Giant group DNV are the independent expert in assurance and risk management, headquartered in Oslo with operations in more than 100 countries. They have a [part of the business](https://www.dnv.com/power-renewables/services/testing/battery-storage.html) dedicated to storage. In [December 2020](https://www.dnv.com/news/dnv-gl-performs-technical-due-diligence-for-gore-street-energy-storage-fund-s-acquisition-of-anesco-s-81-mw-uk-operational-battery-storage-portfolio-192425), selected by Gore Street Capital to undertake a range of technical due diligence services on an 81 MW operational battery storage portfolio.

data.title: Cenex
data.description: Cenex was established as the UK’s first Centre of Excellence for Low Carbon and Fuel Cell technologies in 2005. Cenex focuses on low emission transport & associated energy infrastructure and operates as an independent, not-for-profit research technology organisation (RTO)

data.title: Icebreaker One
data.description: Icebreaker's mission is to Unlock standards-based marketplaces for environmental & financial data and leveraged finance for innovation. Reduce the cost and friction associated with moving data across organisations and markets. Won [phase 2 of SBRI MEDA](https://icebreakerone.org/energy/) competion

data.title: Carbon Intelligence
data.description: London based Carbon Intelligence brings together a team of strategists, technologists, data scientists and engineers. Our sustainability experts believe in business as the solution to a zero-carbon economy, not the problem.

data.title: GreenEnco
data.description: We are providing engineering & technical services and asset performance management to the solar PV stakeholders, from concept planning through to completion.

data.title: Roadnight Taylor
data.description: Helping UK businesses and organisations make the best and safest energy choices that deliver against their specific objectives –  whether that’s reducing bills, generating income, shrinking carbon footprint or increasing resilience and competitiveness.

data.title: SRS Works
data.description: solutions for energy reduction strategies

data.title: Green Yellow
data.description: Paris based. Utilizing the rooftops of stores and warehouses to produce photovoltaic solar power at a large scale

data.title: UK Green Building Council
data.description: UKGBC is uniting the UK building industry using sustainability as a catalyst to positively transform the places people use every day. In March 21 [UKGBC has published](https://www.ukgbc.org/ukgbc-work/renewable-energy-procurement-carbon-offsetting-guidance-for-net-zero-carbon-buildings/) the Renewable Energy Procurement and Carbon Offsetting Guidance for Net Zero Carbon Buildings

data.title: Regen
data.description: Regen offers independent expert advice and market insight on all aspects of sustainable energy delivery. We use our technical expertise, industry research and policy knowledge to support a range of public and private sector organisations to make the most of their clean energy opportunities.

data.title: Ongen
data.description: helping organisations and small businesses save money on energy costs, reduce carbon footprint and secure energy supply.

data.title: Origami
data.description: enterprise technology that enables energy companies to have a single, real-time point of truth across assets, markets and customers

data.title: Flexible Power
data.description: Western Power Distribution, SP Energy Networks, Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks and Northern Powergrid have announced they are collaborating on 'Flexible Power' to signpost and operate all of their flexibility requirements. [In the news, Oct 2020](https://theenergyst.com/four-dnos-collaborate-to-streamline-flexibility-across-networks/)

data.title: Redaptive
data.description: Redaptive develops a strategic program and identify sites to maximize savings across portfolio. Received a $150M round in Oct 2020, src: [crunchbase news](https://news.crunchbase.com/news/redaptive-closes-on-150m-for-energy-efficiency-technologies/)

data.title: Passivesystems
data.description: Passivsystems mission is to create sustainable value through the use of smart technology within the residential energy supply market.

data.title: Scale Microgrid Solutions
data.description: Scale provides the capital needed to enable transformation and creating on-site solutions

data.title: Wartsila
data.description: Wärtsilä is a global leader in smart technologies and complete lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. Deployed several storage projects [in UK for Pivot Power / EDF](https://www.energy-storage.news/blogs/how-energy-storage-helps-energy-assets-connect-with-energy-markets) and around the world

data.title: Eel power
data.description: Eel power have background in solar PV, large scale hydropower and in commercial energy storage co-located at renewable generation sites in the UK. Partnered in Feb 2021 with EDF to optimise 80MW of storage, from [Current News](https://www.current-news.co.uk/news/eelpower-selects-edf-to-optimise-80mw-of-battery-storage)

data.title: Zenobe
data.description: London based Zenobe lower the risk to our clients by eliminating the upfront capital cost and providing the storage as a service. We install, maintain and operate the storage assets so our clients can focus on running their businesses.

data.title: Geli
data.description: Geli, which stands for Growing Energy Labs, Inc., provides software and business solutions for designing, automating, and managing energy storage and microgrid systems.

data.title: David Energy
data.description: A retail electricity supplier vertically integrated and powered by technology. We bring electricity supply and demand response together. [Announced](https://news.crunchbase.com/news/david-energy-announces-19m-to-store-and-deploy-power/) $19 million in funding in Feb 21, which included a $4.1 million seed round and an additional $15 million in capital

data.title: Vector NZ
data.description: New Zealand's largest distributor of electricity and gas. Vector and Amazon Web Services (AWS) are jointly developing a New Energy Platform (NEP) under a multi-year strategic alliance to change how energy is managed, delivered and consumed.

data.title: Myst AI
data.description: We use artificial intelligence to help energy companies better predict the future, resulting in lower costs, reduced risk and less waste. Secured $6M [series A funding](https://news.crunchbase.com/news/myst-ai-closes-6m-series-a-to-forecast-energy-demand-supply/) in Sept 2020

data.title: LCP enact
data.description: LCP Enact is a data integration, analytics and forecasting platform for the GB energy market. Here's the platform described in a sponsored [post on the energyst](https://theenergyst.com/walking-the-bsuos-tightrope/) with numbers for BSUoS charges in 2020

data.title: Powin
data.description: Powin own or manage every step in the energy storage supply chain, born in '89 as a high-quality, high-volume contract manufacturing company with a large supplier network and relationship base in Asia. [In Feb 2021 has raised](https://www.greentechmedia.com/articles/read/powin-energy-raises-100m-to-compete-for-leadership-of-grid-storage-market) more than $100 million in equity investment

data.title: Nrstor
data.description: Canada based, Nrstor develop cost-effective, reliable energy storage projects that create energy cost savings and reduce environmental impact

data.title: Statkfraft
data.description: Statkraft develop and operate renewable energy assets within hydropower, wind, solar, gas and biomass, supply district heating and buy and sell energy. [In the news March 2021](https://www.current-news.co.uk/news/statkraft-to-optimise-100mw-of-gore-street-battery-storage-in-northern-ireland) for optimising 100MW of [Gore Street](https://www.gsenergystoragefund.com/) battery storage in Northern Ireland

data.title: Modo Energy
data.description: Stay on top of the energy storage market. Asset benchmarking, live data, market reports, and news. All in one place. founded and funded by ex kiwi power people

data.title: Triple-A
data.description: identifying “Triple-A” energy efficiency investments, aiming to reduce the respective time and effort required at the crucial phase of the investments conceptualization, as well as to increase transparency and efficiency of respective decision making.

data.title: SENSEI
data.description: SENSEI combines pay-for-performance (P4P) arrangements with the Energy Performance Contracting (EPC) model and engages in negotiation games with preliminary stakeholders.

data.title: CRREM
data.description: Carbon Risk Real Estate Monitor (CRREM)  faces the challenge to estimate risk and uncertainty associated with real estate decarbonization, building a methodological body and empirically quantify the different scenarios and their impact on the investor portfolios. GRESB is in the consortium

data.title: ESMAP
data.description: ESMAP is a partnership between the World Bank  and 18 partners to help low and middle-income countries reduce poverty and boost growth through sustainable energy solutions. ESMAP has an [energy storage program](https://esmap.org/energystorage) that gives access to [WBG $1 billion for a first-of-its kind program](https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/press-release/2018/09/26/world-bank-group-commits-1-billion-for-battery-storage-to-ramp-up-renewable-energy-globally) to accelerate investments in battery storage

data.title: Peak Power
data.description: Peak Power is a global energy technology services provider based in Toronto focused on delivering intelligent software and project solutions to offset the most expensive hours of electric demand for both utilities and building owners.

data.title: Haven Power
data.description: Part of the [Drax Group](https://www.drax.com/about-us/) (suppliers of low-carbon energy), Haven Power is a business utility suitable for users over 50,000 kWh of electricity each year.

data.title: Open Energi
data.description: Open Energi automate and optimise a network of distributed energy resources to reduce energy costs and provide flexible capacity to enable a 100% renewable energy system.

data.title: Everimpact
data.description: Our mission is to make it easier for cities and companies to measure greenhouse gas emissions, identify opportunities to reduce emissions and finance needed investments.

data.title: Habitat Energy
data.description: Habitat Energy provide optimisation and trading services to owners of battery storage and other flexible energy assets. We focus primarily on grid-scale assets, transmission or distribution connected, typically 10 megawatts and above that are pursuing a merchant business model, buying and selling power in the Day Ahead, Intraday and Balancing markets.

data.title: Smart Buildings Alliance
data.description: A unifying approach for the Smart Building in the Smart City: the aim of the SBA association (Smart Buildings Alliance for Smart Cities) is to organise the promotion of the Smart Buildings sector within Smart Cities bringing together a group of industry players.

data.title: GridIO
data.description: device for household virtual power plant, monitors and controls energy consumption to optimise on tariffs and carbon emissions. Finalists at free electrons 2020

data.title: Stem
data.description: Stem builds and operates the largest digitally connected energy storage network for our customers. Our world class AI platform optimizes the value of our customers' energy assets and facilitates their participation in energy markets, yielding economic and resiliency benefits while accelerating renewable adoption. Athena accurately forecasts energy demand onsite and energy demand on the grid. From [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/article/stem-ma-star-peak-energy/stem-agrees-blank-check-merger-with-star-peak-to-go-public-idUSL8N2IJ5K5): In December 2020 has agreed to go public by merging with blank-check acquisition company [Star Peak Energy](https://www.starpeakcorp.com/home/default.aspx) Transition Corp at a valuation of roughly $1.35 billion.

data.title: Starling Energy Group
data.description: Perth based Starling Energy Group provides integrated energy asset management services that help households, businesses and energy utilities transition to cleaner, greener renewable energy and end their reliance on traditional fossil power.

data.title: Plico
data.description: A project created by Starling Energy Group. By putting a battery in every Plico home we are collectively building the largest grid-scale controllable battery in the SWIS which will speed up the transition.

data.title: Nikola Power
data.description: Nikola Power is building a software infrastructure which seamlessly integrates and manages millions of distributed energy resources.

data.title: Swell Energy
data.description: Swell Energy is a residential and commercial energy storage, solar, and grid solutions provider. We’ve achieved this with smart, innovative partnerships with the best utilities, tech providers, OEMs, contractors, and brands. From [Techcrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/10/residential-renewable-energy-developer-swell-is-raising-450-million-for-distributed-power-projects-in-three-states/): In December 2020 is raising $450 million to finance the construction of four virtual power plants

data.title: Elli
data.description: Elli is the "Electricity Life" brand owned by VW group, announcing their [intention to become a power supplier](https://www.volkswagen-newsroom.com/en/press-releases/volkswagen-to-become-a-power-supplier-4551)

data.title: Centre for net zero
data.description: founded by Octopus, launched in Feb 2021. Will focus (probably) on agent-based energy grid modelling and (hopefully) releasing their models open source

data.title: CarbonLaces
data.description: Climate Finance Platform that defines a new category called ‘buildings as a hub of activity’ and recommends actions based on efficiency

data.title: Novisto
data.description: software solution for integrated corporate sustainability management. [Closed a $9.6 million CAD](https://betakit.com/novisto-raises-9-6-million-cad-series-a-round-to-innovate-esg-for-enterprises/) ($8 million USD) Series A round in May 2021

data.title: GRESB
data.description: GRESB mission is to enhance and protect shareholder value by assessing and empowering sustainability practices in the real asset sector. Providing environmental, social and governance (ESG) performance on assets. (mentioned in Fabriq newsletter)

data.title: Metabolic
data.description: Metabolic did the Smart Integrated Decentralised Energy (SIDE) systems research published by [world economic forum](https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2018/09/these-dutch-microgrid-communities-can-supply-90-of-their-energy-needs/)

data.title: Spectral
data.description: Spectral a metabolic spin-off (nice domain), worth watching what they do [link on Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jB3hMVYXSKk) they should also have an energy monitoring platform a bit like Fabriq but not sure it’s PaaS

data.title: Carbon lighthouse
data.description: Carbon lighthouse US based Commercial solar consultancy

data.title: kwhanalytics
data.description: kwhanalytics Investment risk management in solar, a platform

data.title: Lumenaza
data.description: Lumenaza software company for energy flow

data.title: Energy Market Price
data.description: Energy Market Price software and bespoke solutions for industrial / consultants / suppliers who need to track energy price (e.g. a dashboard for EDF)

data.title: Engadged Tracking
data.description: Engadged Tracking a new approach to sustainable and ESG investing, ranking the world’s largest listed companies according to their Scope 1, 2 and 3 greenhouse gas emissions each year.

data.title: Carbon Delta
data.description: Carbon Delta funded by climate-kic, companies carbon footprint monitoring / environmental fintech

data.title: Energy way
data.description: Energy way is an Italy based consultancy, Rita Cucchiara is in the advisory board

data.title: Brixton energy
data.description: Brixton energy a tiny cooperative installing renewables in south london, I'm sure there's plenty but hey, I'm a Londoner :joy:

data.title: CoEnergy
data.description: CoEnergy by Andre Pinho who's involved in Brixton energy as well, wants to simplify community energy schemas for both investment and management

data.title: Repowering London
data.description: Repowering London is a not-for-profit organisation that specialises in facilitating the co-production of community-owned renewable energy projects. Affiliated with CoEnergy.

data.title: Eco Energi
data.description: Eco Energi UK based service provider / consultancy for transition to sustainable, mainly residential

data.title: Pexapark
data.description: Pexapark is a Zurich based consultancy specialised in PPA deals

data.title: New Resource Partners
data.description: UK based New Resource partners provide strategy advice and techno-economic due diligence on renewable, flexible and smart energy technologies. Found through a KTN call.

data.title: Nispera
data.description: Nispera renewable portfolio performance monitoring, asset management, weather forecast for power, bespoke solutions

data.title: Digital Engineering
data.description: Digital Engineering data analytics services for assets monitoring and forecasting, based in Bristol

data.title: Kyos
data.description: Kyos asset management and optimisation, energy market analytics

data.title: Inspired Energy
data.description: Inspired Energy Manchester based, big company providing all sorts of professional services for energy distributors, businesses etc.

data.title: D2H engineering
data.description: D2H engineering consultancy company in Indianapolis and UK, several projects in energy including a battery model

data.title: Anthesis
data.description: Since establishing in 2013, Anthesis Group has grown to more than 600 sustainability experts, through organic growth and strategic acquisitions.

data.title: Volans
data.description: From inception, Volans has strived to span the yawning divide between current approaches to sustainability and what’s needed to create a truly sustainable future for all.

data.title: Climate.Careers
data.description: Climate.Careers - job board: a social enterprise that exists to help people align their careers with solving climate change

data.title: Delta EE
data.description: Delta-EE provides research to the new energy industry through research services and bespoke consultancy projects, depending on the individual client's needs.

data.title: Avieco - formerly Carbon Smart
data.description: Avieco / Carbon Smart help businesses take the sustainability steps that make sense to them

data.title: Carbon limiting technologies
data.description: Carbon limiting technologies works with industry and government to commercialise low carbon innovations and accelerate clean growth

data.title: Emergent
data.description: Emergent is a startup developing renewable projects for landlords, they are probably both product and consultancy, a bit like Spectral, founder [Reg Platt](https://www.linkedin.com/in/reg-platt-11a38321/)

data.title: Open Grid Systems Ltd.
data.description: Open Grid Systems Ltd.  is a software and consultancy company providing services to the electrical power industry focussed on model-driven software engineering, open standards and cutting-edge technologies.

data.title: EnergySage
data.description: EnergySage is on a mission to make going solar as easy as booking a flight online. Funded by Clean energy ventures (see business section)

data.title: Innovation Gateway
data.description: The Innovation Gateway is an alliance of organisations working in partnership to reduce the costs and environmental impacts of their buildings; through innovations in energy, waste, water, productivity and wellbeing.

data.title: Better Buildings Partnership
data.description: Better Buildings Partnership is a collaboration of the uk's leading commercial property owners who are working together to improve the sustainability of existing commercial building stock.

data.title: Construction Innovation Hub
data.description: The Construction Innovation Hub brings together expertise from [BRE](https://www.bregroup.com/), the [Manufacturing Technology Centre (MTC)](http://www.the-mtc.org/) and the [Centre for Digital Built Britain (CDBB)](https://www.cdbb.cam.ac.uk/) to transform the UK construction industry.

data.title: Joule Assets
data.description: Joule Assets empower communities to access cleaner and cheaper energy through an investment platform aimed at implementing clean energy solutions

data.title: Element Energy
data.description: Element Energy is a team of experts based in Cambridge, London, York and Lille who specialise in the intelligent analysis of low carbon energy.

data.title: Masdar
data.description: Masdar, or Abu Dhabi Future Energy Company, is a global leader in renewable energy and sustainable urban development. Masdar means ‘source’ in Arabic. - related article: [How green can a building be?](https://blogs.thomsonreuters.com/sustainability/2019/02/13/executive-perspective-how-green-can-a-building-be/)

data.title: GridBeyond
data.description: GridBeyond enables participation in Demand Side Response, including grid revenue programmes and enhanced energy savings through peak avoidance and trading. Winners of BusinessGreen [Tech Awards 2019](https://gridbeyond.com/gridbeyond-wins-smart-grid-technology-of-the-year-award-at-businessgreen-technology-awards-2019/) in the Smart Grid category

data.title: Greenkeper
data.description: Greenkeper is a consultancy that develops a data-driven tool to analyse performance and inform investment approaches to urban green infrastructure.

data.title: Normative
data.description: Normative want to accelerate the transition towards net zero emissions. We provide emission accounting based on science, empowering companies to reduce their carbon footprint.

data.title: Plan A
data.description: Plan A has developed a Carbon Reduction Software which helps businesses calculate, monitor and reduce their carbon footprint on a monthly basis.

data.title: Natural Capital Partners
data.description: Natural Capital Partners works with clients to deliver solutions that ensure immediate, positive impact on the world’s natural capital. They developed the [CarbonNeutral Protocol](https://www.carbonneutral.com/who-we-are) to provide a clear set of guidelines for businesses to achieve carbon neutrality.

data.title: Cleantech Group
data.description: Cleantech Group provide research, consulting and events to catalyze opportunities for sustainable growth powered by innovation.

data.title: Energy Managers Association
data.description: Energy Managers Association aims to: Improve the standing of the Energy Management profession and those working within it, Establish best-practice in Energy Management, Put Energy Management at the heart of British business

data.title: Bloomberg NEF
data.description: Bloomberg NEF "new energy finance" is the branch of Bloomberg specialised in consultancies around the energy sector, this was a company founded by [Michael Liebreich](https://twitter.com/MLiebreich) in 2004 and acquired by Bloomberg in 2009

data.title: Business green
data.description: Business green uk based media and events in the cleantech world

data.title: The Energyst
data.description: The Energyst magazine featuring latest energy technology and strategies along with articles on legislative and policy changes.

data.title: Greenbiz
data.description: Greenbiz Media company interesting article about long-term sustainability of solar panel recycling

data.title: Energy Saving Trust
data.description: Energy Saving Trust is an independent organisation – working to address the climate emergency.

data.title: Open Climate Fix
data.description: Open Climate Fix is a non-profit product lab, totally focused on reducing greenhouse gas emissions as rapidly as possible. Received [funding](https://openclimatefix.org/blog/2021-04-13-googleorg-support) from [Google Impact Challenge](https://impactchallenge.withgoogle.com/climate2020)

data.title: Green Finance Index
data.description: Green Finance Index an initiative sponsored by the MAVA Foundation, and delivered by Finance Watch and Long Finance, that seeks to encourage financial centres to become greener and develop financial services in a way that enables society to live within planetary boundaries.

data.title: The European Energy Centre
data.description: The European Energy Centre is an Independent Educational Body for the Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Sectors. Awards the [Galileo Master Certificate](https://www.euenergycentre.org/energy-qualifications/) energy qualification

data.title: The Smart Electric Power Alliance (SEPA)
data.description: The Smart Electric Power Alliance (SEPA)  is a US non-profit organization dedicated to working with electric power stakeholders through the most pressing issues affecting the growth and utilization of smart energy.

data.title: World Energy Council
data.description: WEC define, enable and accelerate successful energy transitions while maintaining a technology and resource neutral global perspective and through the widespread use of a flexible Transition Leadership Toolkit, insight, interactive events and dynamic platforms to delivery strategic moments of impact.

data.title: Climate Change Committee (CCC)
data.description: The Climate Change Committee (CCC) is an independent, statutory body whose purpose is to advise the UK and devolved governments on emissions targets and to report to Parliament on progress made in reducing greenhouse gas emissions and preparing for and adapting to the impacts of climate change.

data.title: IEA
data.description: IEA Founded in 1974, the IEA was initially designed to help countries co-ordinate a collective response to major disruptions in the supply of oil, such as the crisis of 1973/4. While this remains a key aspect of its work, the IEA has evolved and expanded significantly.

data.title: UNFCCC
data.description: UNFCCC United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change organises the Conference of Parties, organised the [COP24](https://unfccc.int/katowice) event in Katowice, Poland Dec '18

data.title: The climate group
data.description: The climate group an international non-profit, founded in 2004, with offices in London, New Delhi and New York.

data.title: Carbon Trust
data.description: Carbon Trust an independent, expert partner of leading organisations around the world, helping them contribute to and benefit from a more sustainable future.

data.title: CDP
data.description: CDP is a not-for-profit charity that runs the global disclosure system for investors, companies, cities, states and regions to manage their environmental impacts

data.title: Mission Innovation
data.description: Mission Innovation 24 government consortium, recently presented the SGIA accelerator, ties with B-T ventures

data.title: Ofgem
data.description: Ofgem gas & electricity market authority

data.title: Ashden
data.description: Ashden organisation with award and funding, check the eligibility criteria

data.title: Action sustainability
data.description: Action sustainability

data.title: environmental progress
data.description: supporting nuclear environmental progress , really good newsletter, the guy writes on Forbes

data.title: UK100
data.description: UK100 clean communities

data.title: Royal Society
data.description: Royal Society

data.title: Client earth
data.description: Client earth - check their survey UK 20.8.18 supporting urgent action on climate change: [link](https://www.clientearth.org/british-public-supports-urgent-action-and-litigation-on-climate-change-poll-reveals/) linked from [link](https://www.independent.co.uk/environment/solar-panels-government-cuts-funding-british-tesla-a8500051.html)

data.title: Climate CoLab
data.description: Work with people from all over the world to create proposals for how to reach global climate change goals. - go low-carbon contest

data.title: Michael Liebreich foundation
data.description: Michael Liebreich foundation gives small grants for climate & environment projects among other things

data.title: Carbon culture
data.description: Carbon culture community platform that is designed to help people use resources more efficiently. Doesn't seem super active.

data.title: NIPCC
data.description: NIPCC basically the climate change "negationist", a panel of nongovernment scientists and scholars who have come together to present an assessment of the science and economics of global warming.
350 is an international movement of ordinary people working to end the age of fossil fuels and build a world of community-led renewable energy for all.

data.title: Community Energy England (CEE)
data.description: Community Energy England (CEE)  is a not for profit organisation that represents and supports those committed to the community energy sector. They run a [hub](http://hub.communityenergyengland.org/) with a list of supported projects

data.title: Wolverton Community Energy
data.description: Wolverton Community Energy are a registered society, owned and run by members. Working with individuals and businesses in Wolverton and the wider Milton Keynes area to help them become more energy efficient

data.title: CfR
data.description: CfR is an asset locked community interest company (CIC). Surplus profit is re-invested in supporting further community energy initiatives. CfR is an active member of Community Energy England and Regen.

data.title: PowerPaired
data.description: PowerPaired is a matchmaking service for community energy groups and the owners of sites with renewable energy potential, [in the news](https://communityenergyengland.org/news/first-of-its-kind-platform-launches-in-bid-to-boost-community-energy-s-role-in-achieving-uk-net-zero-emissions-targets)

data.title: Climate neutral now
data.description: Climate neutral now carbon offset platform by United Nations [UNFCCC](https://unfccc.int/)

data.title: Mossy earth
data.description: Mossy earth tree planting

data.title: Choose today
data.description: Choose today UN-verified CO2-reducing projects in developing countries

data.title: Offset earth
data.description: Offset earth funds for tree planting foundations

data.title: Trillion trees campaign
data.description: Trillion trees campaign tree planting

data.title: Atmosfair
data.description: Atmosfair a non-profit climate protection organisation with a focus on travel. We actively protect the climate by compensating greenhouse gases through the use of renewable energies, among other activities.

data.title: Nori
data.description: Nori is a marketplace that wants to create a new way for anyone in the world to pay to remove excess carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

data.title: Pachama
data.description: Pachama carbon offsetting by afforestation with satellite imagery, funded by [YC W19](https://blog.ycombinator.com/diego-saez-gil-on-how-pachama-uses-tech-to-help-solve-climate-change/)

data.title: Meteomatics
data.description: Meteomatics specializes on the specific needs of the weather sector, energy and trading sectors

data.title: Energy weather
data.description: Energy weather Germany based

data.title: Watt sight
data.description: Watt sight Norway based, meteo and trading forecast

data.title: European power forecasting
data.description: European power forecasting probably a sister company of Digital Engineering mentioned above, Bristol based (same office), focusing on the power forecasting side

data.title: Conwx
data.description: Conwx high-resolution historical weather data and forecast for power / TSOs / asset management

data.title: Sentinel weather
data.description: Sentinel weather

data.title: the eco experts
data.description: the eco experts for PV + battery installations. (Tried to make an enquiry but they’re just a call centre forwarding the contact to an installer, they wouldn’t even send the contact through without installation permission approval from the landlord. Been recommended to check on their website who can install in the area and contact them directly)

data.title: Labrador
data.description: Labrador like uswitch, has an option for green sources

data.title: Energy Local CIC
data.description: An energy co-op of some sorts, Energy Local has designed a local market that enables households to club together to show when they are using local clean power when it is generated. Awarded phase 2 of UK gov [2020 SENS competition](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smart-energy-savings-sens-competition)

data.title: Igloo
data.description: A utility that combines energy supply with services for energy efficiency including installation of smart thermostats, ev charging, heat pumps. Awarded phase 2 of UK gov [2020 SENS competition](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smart-energy-savings-sens-competition)

data.title: Ripple Energy
data.description: Energy co-op: a co-operatively owned wind farm to supply its owners with their own green electricity via the grid. [On seeders](https://www.seedrs.com/ripple2)

data.title: Future Grid
data.description: Melbourne based Future Grid’s software turns smart meter data into improved grid reliability, asset management and customer safety so that Utilities can deliver safe and reliable electricity. Free Electrons alumni

data.title: Amp Energy
data.description: Amp Energy Canadian, assets behind and in front of the meter, backers of Faraday Grid (see above)

data.title: Smartest Energy
data.description: Smartest Energy they have an interesting periodic report in mailing list

data.title: Smarter business
data.description: Smarter business energy broker for business

data.title: Tonik
data.description: Tonik UK utility with 100% renewable electricity, 10% green gas and 90% carbon offset

data.title: Octopus
data.description: Octopus London based aggregator, green easy to switch energy, there is probably a link with reactive-technologies that I haven’t understood

data.title: Trust power
data.description: Trust power another solar / wind energy company to be launched soon

data.title: OVO energy
data.description: OVO energy provider pledging to provide sustainable power and smart devices for heating optimisation, monitoring, etc.

data.title: EDF DSR
data.description: EDF DSR has a solution for demand side response

data.title: Limejump
data.description: Limejump - Assets managers / demand side response platform / battery and other devices

data.title: Flexitricity
data.description: Flexitricity direct Limejump competitors, monetise energy flexibility. I.e. an energy company that enables the balancing mechanism (check [this link on elexon](https://www.elexon.co.uk/guidance-note/balancing-mechanism-bm-units/))

data.title: Ecotricity
data.description: Ecotricity founder [Dale Vince on wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dale_Vince) is worth checking out

data.title: Pavegen
data.description: Pavegen energy capturing pavement / tiles

data.title: Freevolt
data.description: Freevolt ambient low-energy harvesting

data.title: Earthcube
data.description: Earthcube monitoring solutions based on an automated analysis of geospatial information. (funded by climate-kic)
